rounds.response:
I hold only king-high with no pair, no draw, and minimal showdown value. In a heads-up pot on this river, the value I have left is purely blocker-based: my K♠ blocks some better king-high hands, but this is rarely enough to credibly bluff, especially with a pot sized only 40. Betting anything sizable would fold out hands we already beat (like seven-high) and get snapped off by any pair or better—there’s zero fold equity to recoup.

Checking and reducing variance is correct.

[Check]
